The correct answer is B: [00:02:55 - 00:03:40]. 

In this time segment of the video, it shows a rocket launch followed by a labeled Vanguard I satellite and orbital paths. The narrator then explains that Vanguard 1 measured Earth's asymmetric equatorial bulge and that some even described the planet as a Bartlett pear (with the deviation only yards, not miles). This description matches the content shown in the provided time segment.

The correct answer is C: [00:04:27 - 00:05:12].
In the provided audio clip, there is no explicit mention of a split-screen with a portrait and a statue of Nicolaus Copernicus. The speaker only discusses Copernicus' transition from the geocentric model to the heliocentric model and acknowledges that the old geocentric model was considered good for its time. Therefore, option C is the most accurate answer as it does not reference any visual aids such as a split-screen.
